result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Frank Russell Hayes Jr

defendant.name: Hayes, Frank Russell, Jr
defendant.address: 1311 Michigan Avenue, Lower, South Milwaukee, WI 53172

records.addlTxt:
11:37 AM Defendant Frank Russell Hayes Jr in court.  Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court for Frank Russell Hayes Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense is requesting final pretrial and jury trial dates. Case is adjourned to 11-11-22 at 1:30 pm for final pretrial and 11-16-22 at 8:30 am for jury trial.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Frank Russell Hayes Jr in court. D  Prosecuting attorney Michael J. Odden in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Kerri Cleghorn, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning at the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
Case is adjourned to 10-13-22 at 8:30 am for status conference.
Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Frank Russell Hayes Jr in court.  Prosecuting attorney Michael J. Odden in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for Pretrial Conference held.  Defendant requests additional time to retain private counsel.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.
Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered no contact with AB, RE.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Frank Russell Hayes in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Frank Russell Hayes in custody.  Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
